Missing Marokopa man Tom Phillips: Police tried to get other family members to join media appeal https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/missing-marokopa-man-tom-phillips-police-tried-to-get-other-family-members-to-join-media-appeal/5UY7GTDM4VHG3FFR5PDC2IJ4CA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/missing-marokopa-man-tom-phillips-police-tried-to-get-other-family-members-to-join-media-appeal/5UY7GTDM4VHG3FFR5PDC2IJ4CA/ Azaria HowellThe children's mum was the only family member to speak during a recent police operation. Wed, 10 Jul 2024 00:31:07 +0000 The three children, and their father Tom Phillips, have been missing since December 2021. Cat (inset), the children's mother, spoke out this year, urging Phillips to bring her "babies" home.
Frosty: Coldest morning of winter recorded in Hawke’s Bay https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/frosty-coldest-morning-of-winter-recorded-in-hawkes-bay/B3YQVAWSHBB7VAAHV322FEV4DI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/frosty-coldest-morning-of-winter-recorded-in-hawkes-bay/B3YQVAWSHBB7VAAHV322FEV4DI/ Gary Hamilton-IrvineHeat pumps and fireplaces have been working overtime as temperatures fall below zero. Wed, 10 Jul 2024 00:30:44 +0000 Frost near Havelock North on Wednesday morning. Photo / Warren Buckland
News, results from Gisborne and East Coast golf clubs https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/07/10/news-results-from-gisborne-and-east-coast-golf-clubs/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/07/10/news-results-from-gisborne-and-east-coast-golf-clubs/ Chris TaewaThe semifinalists have been found in Poverty Bay's Barns-Graham Cup men's pairs. Wed, 10 Jul 2024 00:22:14 +0000 Every sporting organisation has them. People who go out of their way to support their club and for the love of the game. One classic example of that locally is retired policeman Ray Farmer, pictured clearing away a huge tree that fell near the 13th tee at Poverty Bay's Awapuni Links course during the recent storm. Ray has done a huge amount of voluntary work at the course over the years, playing a quiet but important support role in its superb condition. And he is not alone. He would be the first to play down his contribution, highlighting instead that it is a team effort and that he has the time others don't. He's right. At times it takes a village, but there are those in that village who consistently raise the hand of help out of loyalty and a sense of community. They don't seek recognition. They don't need an award. A mere thanks will do. So cheers to all the Rays.
Acting Prime Minister Winston Peters to find out more about Interislander Aratere ferry grounding https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/winston-peters-to-find-out-more-about-interislander-aratere-ferry-grounding/7P6XAH4O4RGXBOFPCKLVUIQA6M/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/winston-peters-to-find-out-more-about-interislander-aratere-ferry-grounding/7P6XAH4O4RGXBOFPCKLVUIQA6M/ Georgina CampbellNZ First has questioned whether the autopilot was left on when the ferry got into trouble. Wed, 10 Jul 2024 00:10:35 +0000 NZ First leader and acting Prime Minister Winston Peters.
